column3: What will the effect of these changes to the `xlf` to translators? Do all the messages go back to untranslated or unreviewed?

> What will the effect of these changes to the `xlf` to translators? Do all the messages go back to untranslated or unreviewed?

I don't know for sure (it is out of my personal experience, and it is not documented by Transifex).

Expecting the following:
- the "Translated" status will not be changed
- the "Reviewed" status will be set to "No"
So it might be better to wait until after the 22.0 release to do this? Or is it required to make bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools#103 (and thus translations updates) work?

> Or is it required to make [bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools#103](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools/pull/103) (and thus translations updates) work?\n\nNo, it is not required. But it could change the internal Transifex machinery behavior in a way that would make additional post-processing in bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools#103 unneeded (that is only my guess).\
I guess it could go in now. Needs rebase though.

Rebased ee3322d87fd6527b5f0c240965eef531d1d15bff -> c2846331ff663035e3d1edd4885bf58f3e80ecb3 ([pr22151.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22151.01) -> [pr22151.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22151.02)).

@laanwj 
> I guess it could go in now. Needs rebase though.

Done :tiger2:

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

Update c2846331ff663035e3d1edd4885bf58f3e80ecb3 -> 985d85e9a8d3dd6e52fef27f76b49c5aa4b34f30 ([pr22151.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22151.02) -> [pr22151.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22151.03)):

- rebased
- diff is limited to `src/Makefile.qt.include`, i.e., `make -C src translate` is not applied within this PR now
- a comment added

I'm surprised that custom processing with `sed` is needed here, that there isn't one command to do what we want to do here (extract translations), it shouldn't be a rare thing but something every project needs to do?
